title: Ping isn't what's reported via services.
body:
This has bothered me for quite the while regarding my ping throughout games. 
Jump down to problem if you don't feel like reading. 

_**Things to keep in mind. **_

I am already aware that my Internet Connection is on the lower side of the performance chart, not only because I use a wireless adapter; moreover, due to problems with my ISP [ATT]
This factors out many of the problems I typically have such as ping spikes, latency in general, and Internet drops in general.

Now for some of these issues above I have tried switching to Ethernet; however, my current setup operates on two floors in opposite sectors from each other [Screw me Right?] Despite this for the data, I temporarily hauled everything to my router [Router is stationary] and tested my setup. Overall nothing truly changed, and my ping stayed the same. 

_**Problem **_
 
Upon using Riot's Lag Report Feature today I noticed information that bothered me as my reported average was set at 54ms which is true based on my in-game experience. The problem here. Those around me receive pings of around 20-30 never spilling into the 50's range and this is further aligned with the data in the Lag Report as nearby players max caps at 48. 
A while back I noticed this upon checking the hextech tool noticing my ping was reported around 24-26 avg. with min. max. ranges all relative too.
My ping used to be 51 avg with a min of 48-49; however, recently as in within the last 3-5 months it spiked up to 54.

Does anyone have any clues, hints, leads, to how I can solve this problem?

replies.body: Hmmmm sounds like this might be centered around your network settings if other players in your area have been able to get down to 20-30 ms. Let's try adjusting your Port Forwarding and DNS settings really quickly following those steps in this [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues). Test that in a custom or practice match and let me know if that doesn't help at all.
Sorry late reply, however I've tried the suggested methods, and still experience connection issues.
